name: Assess airway
description: A - Airway. Detailed airway assessment to determine if the patient's airway is clear and functioning

name: Assess breathing
description: B - Breathing. Detailed assessment of breathing to evaluate the quality, rate, and effectiveness of respirations

name: Assess circulation
description: C - Circulation. Detailed assessment of the circulatory system to evaluate the patient's heart rate, blood pressure, and perfusion

name: Assess disability
description: D - Disability. Detailed assessment of current level of consciousness, using tools such as the Glasgow Coma Scale
exampleInputs: Check the patient's level of consciousness
examples: Check the patient's level of consciousness

name: Assess exposure
description: E - Exposure. Detailed assessment for injuries, bruising, rashes, etc by completely exposing the patient while maintaining privacy and warmth
exampleInputs: Look for visible signs of trauma
Check for abnormalities in skin color or temperature
examples: Look for visible signs of trauma
Check for abnormalities in skin color or temperature

name: Review ABCDE
description: Go over the status of the airway, breathing, circulation, disability, and exposure assessments
exampleInputs: Can you review the ABCDE status?
How are we doing on ABCDE?
examples: Can you review the ABCDE status?
How are we doing on ABCDE?

name: Obtain IV access ($location)
description: Establish an intravenous line for fluid or medication administration.
exampleInputs: Can we get an IV in? Right arm

examples.input: Let's get an IV in
Obtain IV access - right arm
Can we get an IV in? Right arm

name: Obtain IO access ($location, $size)
description: Establish intraosseous access when IV access is not possible. User MUST specify location and size.
exampleInputs: Can we get IO access? Right humerus, 25mm

examples.input: Let's try for IO access
Obtain IO access - right tibia, 15mm
Can we get IO access? Right humerus, 25mm

name: Give oxygen via mask ($flow)
description: Administer oxygen through a face mask
exampleInputs: Give oxygen via mask at 5 liters per minute

examples.input: Give oxygen via mask at 5 liters per minute
Give oxygen via mask at 10L/min

name: Give oxygen via nasal cannula ($flow)
description: Administer oxygen through a nasal cannula
exampleInputs: Give oxygen via nasal cannula at 2 liters per minute
Start oxygen therapy, nasal cannula at 4L/min

examples.input: Give oxygen via nasal cannula at 2 liters per minute
Start oxygen therapy, nasal cannula at 4L/min

name: Give oxygen via non-rebreather mask ($flow)
description: Administer oxygen through a non-rebreather mask
exampleInputs: Start oxygen, non-rebreather mask at 10 liters per minute
Give oxygen via non-rebreather mask at 15L/min

examples.input: Start oxygen, non-rebreather mask at 10 liters per minute
Give oxygen via non-rebreather mask at 15L/min

name: Give oxygen via bag valve mask ($flow)
description: Administer oxygen through a bag valve mask
exampleInputs: Let's get the BVM on, 15 liters per minute
Give oxygen via bag valve mask at 15L/min please
exampleActions: Give oxygen via bag valve mask (15L/min)
Give oxygen via bag valve mask (15L/min)

examples.input: Let's get the BVM on, 15 liters per minute
examples.action: Give oxygen via bag valve mask (15L/min)

examples.input: Give oxygen via bag valve mask at 15L/min please
examples.action: Give oxygen via bag valve mask (15L/min)

name: Give oxygen via blow-by ($flow)
description: Administer oxygen in the vicinity of the patient's nose and mouth without directly attaching to the patient - typically used for children or individuals who do not tolerate other oxygen delivery methods
exampleInputs: Start blow-by oxygen at 5 liters per minute

examples.input: Start blow-by oxygen at 5 liters per minute
Give oxygen via blow-by, 10 liters/minute

name: Intubate ($size, $type)
description: Insert a tube into the patient's trachea to secure the airway and facilitate ventilation

examples.input: Intubate with a 7.5mm cuffed tube
Start intubation, 8.0mm uncuffed

requirements: The patient must be unconscious or sedated

name: Connect BP monitor
description: Attach a blood pressure monitor to the patient to continuously monitor blood pressure
exampleInputs: Let's get the blood pressure monitor on
examples: Let's get the blood pressure monitor on

name: Connect EKG/ECG
description: Attach electrocardiogram leads to the patient to monitor the heart's electrical activity

name: Connect pulse oximeter
description: Attach a pulse oximeter to the patient to monitor their oxygen saturation
exampleInputs: Connect pulse oximeter to patient's finger
Connect pulse oximeter to patient's earlobe
examples: Connect pulse oximeter to patient's finger
Connect pulse oximeter to patient's earlobe

name: Take blood glucose reading
description: Use a glucometer to measure the patient's blood glucose level
exampleInputs: Take a blood glucose reading from patient's finger
We need to check glucose level
examples: Take a blood glucose reading from patient's finger
We need to check glucose level

name: Take temperature reading
description: Measure the patient's body temperature
exampleInputs: Can we get a temperature reading?
examples: Can we get a temperature reading?

name: Auscultate heart
description: Listen to the heart sounds to evaluate rate, rhythm, and the presence of any abnormal sounds
exampleInputs: Can we get a heart ascultation?
examples: Can we get a heart ascultation?

name: Auscultate lungs
description: Listen to the breath sounds to assess for any abnormal sounds
exampleInputs: Is there anything abnormal in the lungs?
We need to check for any abnormal sounds in the lungs
examples: Is there anything abnormal in the lungs?
We need to check for any abnormal sounds in the lungs

name: Auscultate abdomen
description: Listen to the bowel sounds to assess for any abnormal sounds
exampleInputs: Is there anything abnormal in the abdomen?
We need to check for any abnormal sounds in the abdomen
examples: Is there anything abnormal in the abdomen?
We need to check for any abnormal sounds in the abdomen

name: Check capillary refill
description: Evaluate the time it takes for color to return to an external capillary bed after pressure is applied
exampleInputs: We need to assess the capillary refill time
examples: We need to assess the capillary refill time

name: Chin lift
description: Maneuver used to open the airway by pulling the chin upward while tilting the head back

name: Jaw thrust
description: Maneuver used to open the airway by moving the jaw forward without moving the neck

name: Head tilt
description: Maneuver used to open the airway by tilting the head backward while lifting the chin

name: Administer medication ($medication, $dose, $route)
description: Give the patient a specific medication at a specified dose and route
exampleInputs: Push 0.1 mg of epinephrine via IV
We need to give 500 mg of amoxicillin orally

examples.input: Push 0.1 mg of epinephrine via IV
We need to give 500 mg of amoxicillin orally

requirements: Must have access for the desired route
Exact dose must be calculated by the user

name: Titrate oxygen ($targetSaturation)
description: Adjust the flow rate of oxygen to achieve a target oxygen saturation
exampleInputs: Titrate oxygen to maintain oxygen saturation above 94%

examples.input: Titrate oxygen to maintain oxygen saturation above 94%
Titrate for saturation to 98%

requirements: Patient must be on supplemental oxygen, or oxygen therapy must be in progress

name: Monitor for change ($reason)
description: Monitor the patient for a change in condition, usually following from a specific intervention
exampleInputs: Monitor to see if <intervention> is working

examples.input: <give medication>... and monitor for improvement
Monitor to see if <intervention> is working

name: Check pulse
description: Manually assess the patient's pulse rate and rhythm. Will be done at any pulse point.
exampleInputs: Can we get a pulse check?
examples: Can we get a pulse check?

name: CPR
description: Perform chest compressions and rescue breaths to maintain circulation and oxygenation
requirements: Patient must be unconscious and not breathing

name: Prepare bolus ($fluid, $volume)
description: Prepare a bolus of a specific fluid at a specific volume
exampleInputs: Prepare a 500 mL bolus of normal saline
Can you prepare a bolus ringer acetate 120 milliliters

examples.input: Prepare a 500 mL bolus of normal saline
Can you prepare a bolus ringer acetate 120 milliliters

name: Wait ($event)
description: Wait for a specific event to occur, for example another nurse preparing IV access.
exampleInputs: Wait for IV access to be established
Do X when the nurse has prepared the bolus
Administer bolus once we have IV access

examples.input: Wait for IV access to be established
Do X when the nurse has prepared the bolus
Administer bolus once we have IV access

name: Administer bolus ($bolus)
description: Give the patient a bolus of fluid
exampleInputs: Administer the bolus nurse Smith prepared

examples.input: Give the patient the bolus
Administer the bolus nurse Smith prepared

requirements: A bolus must be prepared and ready to be administered

name: Talk to parent
description: Talk to the patient's caregiver (ie parent, guardian, etc) to get more information about the patient and their medical history
exampleInputs: Can we get a history from the parent please
Can we get the patient's caregiver in here?
examples: Can we get a history from the parent please
Can we get the patient's caregiver in here?
